intro: Hieracium nigrescens var. vapenicanum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, achene fruits with pappus for wind dispersal. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats.
